She lost the one she loved when trying to save them. She didn’t...
body:
This is me getting too into TikTok. My jedi OC Fre’shavacodo.

She lost the one she loved when trying to save them. She didn’t know force lightning was something she could do until it was too late.

summary: I know I endlessly critique the child abducting cult that is the Jedi Order but I just realised padawans like Ahsoka were stolen...
body: I know I endlessly critique the child abducting cult that is the Jedi Order but I just realised padawans like Ahsoka were stolen at the age of 3… meaning fully grown Jedi Masters, Holy Protectors of The Light and The Galactic Republic had to potty train their apprentices and change their diapers.

reblog.comment: I know I endlessly critique the child abducting cult that is the Jedi Order but I just realised padawans like Ahsoka were stolen at the age of 3… meaning fully grown Jedi Masters, Holy Protectors of The Light and The Galactic Republic had to potty train their apprentices and change their diapers.

summary: I'm working on a story for a friend right now and already I'm cringing because I know what the reaction will be. The story is...
body:
I’m working on a story for a friend right now and already I’m cringing because I know what the reaction will be. The story is about a very banged up, sarcastic clone trooper meeting a damn near immortal Sith Lord (and yes, we do ship it)…and I can already tell the reaction from the peanut gallery.

It’s actually made me not want to write it. Harassment on Quotev actually made me pull a Reylo story and leave the site. I’m on several fiction (or as the OP put it: pro animal fucking and pro abuse) block lists because I do ship Reylo and I do ship ObiMaul, Rexsoka, Codywan, and even Finnlo if I’m in the mood for it.

I just don’t wanna get harassed for writing about Copper and Sarel.

I’ve been told that if you have to find an AU for something, that’s when you know it’s bad and abusive and you shouldn’t ship it. My theory on that is that I find AUs when I wanna say “screw canon!” for whatever reason (usually because I don’t like how a character is portrayed, but also because I get bored).

I’m just a little unnerved about how this bullshit and harassment is starting to bleed into other projects.

tags: writing this out just made me burst into tears
summary: I'm so happy that I saw what you wrote to anonymous about the TRoS's ending being platonic. A mutual surprised me today by...
question: I'm so happy that I saw what you wrote to anonymous about the TRoS's ending being platonic. A mutual surprised me today by telling me that she thinks that it will end with Rey and Ben having something there between them but being too damaged at that point in time to be a couple. I was actually shocked. Of course, she's free to feel that way, but I can't see a nine film saga ending on that kind of note especially when reverse Anidala is factored in.
answer:
The original Star Wars was shocking when it came out in the 70s because it landed after the Vietnam war ended, after a decade of grim sad edgy movies with gray protagonists who didn’t necessarily win or even live.

And it was rejuvenating. Star Wars was a simple story that was not afraid to have fun or show the heroes win unabashedly against evil and have a medal ceremony with a fanfare. The movie resonated because it was so optimistic, almost miraculously earnest. People just need that sometimes. People talk about their favorite movies, but they start crying when they talk about Star Wars. There’s something about it, it promises happiness at the end, happiness for children and parents, peace and fireworks and love and celebration.

The group of youths will move into adulthood successfully with no reservations. The message will be that all wounds may heal in time, all prodigal children will return to the fold, and compassionate selfless love is the greatest power in existence. That’s the message of Star Wars, the feeling it leaves you with.

That’s the message of Star Wars, the feeling it leaves you with.
